title: Criticism of the Bible - Collection 29
description:
Criticism of the Bible - Collection 29:

We have 22 titles in this upload:

-  Biliarsky - The Tale of the Prophet Isaiah; the Destiny and Meaning of an Apocryphal Text (2013)

-  Borgen - The Gospel of John; More Light from Philo, Paul and Archaeology (2014)

-  Brueggemann - An Introduction to the Old Testament; the Canon and Christian Imagination, 2e (2003)

-  Childs - Biblical Theology of the Old and New Testaments; Theological Reflections on the Christian Bible (1992)

-  Cline - From Eden to Exile; Unraveling Mysteries of the Bible (2007)

-  Evans - The Language and Logic of the Bible; the Earlier Middle Ages (1984)

-  Garrow - The Gospel of Matthew's Dependence on the Didache (2004)

-  Gaudet - Quine on Meaning; the Indeterminacy of Translation (2006)

-  Grypeou & Spurling - The Book of Genesis in Late Antiquity; Encounters between Jewish and Christian Exegesis (2013)

-  Kalisch - A Guide for Rational Inquiries into the Biblical Writings (1857)

-  Leloup - The Gospel of Philip; Jesus, Mary Magdalene, and the Gnosis of Sacred Union (2003)

-  Mack - Who Wrote the New Testament; the Making of the Christian Myth (1995)

-  Mazor - Who Wrought the Bible; Unveiling the Bible's Aesthetic Secrets (2009)

-  Moule - Essays in New Testament Interpretation (1982)

-  Pagels - Revelations; Visions, Prophecy & Politics in the Book of Revelation (2012)

-  Roskam - The Purpose of the Gospel of Mark in Its Historical and Social Context (2004)

-  Stanley - Paul and the Language of Scripture; Citation Technique in the Pauline Epistles and Contemporary Literature (1992)

-  Steussy - Samuel and His God (2010)

-  Tregelles - An Account of the Printed Text of the Greek New Testament; with Remarks on Its Revision Upon Critical Principles (1854)

-  Wells - The Skeptic's Annotated Bible (2012)

-  Wright - Inventing God's Law; How the Covenant Code of the Bible Used and Revised the Laws of Hammurabi (2009)
